title: Man, 49, 'tied girlfriend, 22, to bed and sliced her up with a knife'
text:

A man who tied his younger girlfriend to a bed and sliced her body with a knife remained "calm" as he stood beside a pool of blood, a court heard.

Jason Farrell, 49, is said to have butchered Sammy-Lee Lodwig, 22, at his flat in a "brutal attack"

A court heard he calmly told neighbours about the killing just minutes later.

"As I looked at him I began to register he was covered in blood.

"I can't get over his face, how calm he was. It was spooky," Jamie Myles, who lived in a flat near Farrell's, said in a statement read out at Swansea Crown Court today.

Farrell told police he stabbed Miss Lodwig after a row at the address in Swansea.

Her body was found covered in blood on April 23.

(Image: MEDIA WALES)

Claire Morse, a forensic scientist, said tests on two makeshift belts found at the property were consistent with being placed in or around Ms Lodwig's mouth while she was being attacked.

The expert told the court the distribution of Ms Lodwig's blood and DNA evidence in Farrell's bedroom and on his clothing were compatible with the way he later allegedly confessed to murdering her.

But while the defendant denies murder, he has pleaded guilty to manslaughter, an alternative charge for the killing.

(Image: PA)

Michael Jones, prosecuting, said Farrell confessed to the killing in a chilling letter.

"That letter confessed to murder of Sammy-Lee," the lawyer said.

"He'd actually used the word 'murdered'.

"We say it's a chilling document and one you will be able to see and read for yourself."

(Image: Jonathan Myers)

The prosecutor said Farrell was also accused of a "brutal attack" on Christopher Maher, the new boyfriend of Ms Lodwig's mother, just days before the alleged murder.

Farrell had split from Sarah Lodwig in 2010 after receiving a 13-year sentence for stabbing another man.

He denies murder, wounding with intent, and unlawful wounding.

The trial continues.
description: Jason Farrell allegedly murdered Sammy-Lee Lodwig at his flat in Swansea, south Wales
